net.hudup.evaluate

Class Accuracy

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.evaluate.AbstractMetric
      • net.hudup.core.evaluate.DefaultMetric
        • net.hudup.evaluate.Accuracy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Alg, Metric
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClassificationAccuracy, CorrelationAccuracy, PredictiveAccuracy

    public abstract class Accuracy
extends DefaultMetric
    Currently, two default metrics inherited from DefaultMetric class are TimeMetric class and Accuracy class. TimeMetric measures the speed of algorithm and so it is the time in seconds that methods Recommender.estimate(net.hudup.core.alg.RecommendParam, Set) and Recommender.recommend(net.hudup.core.alg.RecommendParam, int) execute over Dataset. Accuracy reflects goodness and efficiency of recommendation algorithms. There are three types of accuracy.
    • Predictive accuracy, represented by PredictiveAccuracy class, measures how close predicted ratings returned from methods Recommender.estimate(net.hudup.core.alg.RecommendParam, Set) and Recommender.recommend(net.hudup.core.alg.RecommendParam, int) are to the true user ratings. PredictiveAccuracy class derives directly from Accuracy class. MAE, MSE, RMSE are typical predictive accuracy metrics.
    • Classification accuracy, represented by ClassificationAccuracy class, measures the frequency that methods Recommender.estimate(net.hudup.core.alg.RecommendParam, Set) and Recommender.recommend(net.hudup.core.alg.RecommendParam, int) make correct or incorrect recommendation. ClassificationAccuracy class derives directly from Accuracy class. Precision and Recall are typical classification accuracy metrics.
    • Correlation accuracy, represented by CorrelationAccuracy class, measures the ability that method Recommender.recommend(net.hudup.core.alg.RecommendParam, int) makes the ordering of recommended items which is similar to the ordering of user's favorite items. CorrelationAccuracy class derives directly from Accuracy class. NDPM, Spearman, Pearson are typical correlation accuracy metrics.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:

      • recalc

        public boolean recalc(java.lang.Object... params)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Metric
        This is the most important method expressing how to re-calculate a concrete metric according to specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        params - specified array of objects known as parameters. Such parameters varied according to concrete metric.
        Returns:
        whether calculating successfully
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any error raises.

      • calc

        protected MetricValue calc(RatingVector recommended,
                           Dataset testing)
        Calculating metric value at an iteration.
        Parameters:
        recommended - recommended list of items.
        testing - testing dataset.
        Returns:
        MetricValue at an iteration.

      • calc

        protected abstract MetricValue calc(RatingVector recommended,
                                    RatingVector vTesting,
                                    Dataset testing)
        Calculating metric value at a iteration of algorithm execution. The calculation is based on comparing recommended rating vector and testing rating vector. Because this is abstract method, all classes inherits from Accuracy must define it.
        Parameters:
        recommended - list of recommended items known as recommended rating vector which is produced by recommendation process.
        vTesting - the testing rating vector which is used to compare with recommended rating vector.
        testing - testing dataset where the testing rating vector is extracted.
        Returns:
        MetricValue at a iteration of algorithm execution.

      • isRelevant

        protected static boolean isRelevant(double rating,
                                    Dataset testing)
        Testing whether the specified rating value is relevant. Note, a rating value is relevant if it is larger than or equal to the average rating (rating mean). The average rating is a half of the deviation {@link DataConfig#getMaxRating()} - {@link DataConfig#getMinRating()}. Such DataConfig is configuration of the specified testing dataset.
        Parameters:
        rating - specified rating value.
        testing - specified testing dataset whose maximum rating value and minium rating value are used to calculate the rating average.
        Returns:
        true if specified rating value is relevant. Otherwise, specified rating value is irrelevant.

      • extractRelevant

        protected static RatingVector extractRelevant(RatingVector vRating,
                                              boolean relevant,
                                              Dataset testing)
        Extracting relevant (irrelevant) ratings from the specified rating vector. Such relevant (irrelevant) ratings form a new rating vector as a result. This method calls isRelevant(double, Dataset) method to test whether a rating value is relevant.
        Parameters:
        vRating - specified rating vector from which relevant (irrelevant) ratings are extracted.
        relevant - if true, the result is vector of relevant ratings. Otherwise, the result is a vector of irrelevant ratings.
        testing - specified testing dataset whose maximum rating value and minium rating value are used to calculate the rating average for relevant testing in method isRelevant(double, Dataset).
        Returns:
        new rating vector with relevant (irrelevant) ratings.

      • countForRelevant

        protected static int countForRelevant(RatingVector vRating,
                                      boolean relevant,
                                      Dataset testing)
        Counting relevant (irrelevant) ratings from the specified rating vector. Such relevant (irrelevant) ratings form a new rating vector as a result. This method calls isRelevant(double, Dataset) method to test whether a rating value is relevant.
        Parameters:
        vRating - specified rating vector from which relevant (irrelevant) ratings are counted.
        relevant - if true, the result is the count of relevant ratings. Otherwise, the result is the count of irrelevant ratings.
        testing - specified testing dataset whose maximum rating value and minium rating value are used to calculate the rating average for relevant testing in method isRelevant(double, Dataset).
        Returns:
        number of relevant (irrelevant) ratings.

      • pruneUnrated

        protected static RatingVector pruneUnrated(RatingVector recommended,
                                           Dataset testing)
        This method prunes the specified recommended vector by removing items from this vector if such items are not rated in the specified testing dataset.
        Parameters:
        recommended - specified recommended vector of ratings.
        testing - specified testing dataset.
        Returns:
        new rating vector whose items are rated in the specified testing dataset.
